title: Robbie Fowler reveals why Jurgen Klopp turned down Manchester United
text:
Klopp was offered the United job (Picture: Getty)

Jurgen Klopp rejected Manchester United because he ‘hated’ their obsession with the commercial side of football.

United’s executive vice-chairman Ed Woodward has always overseen a lucrative business for the Glazers, but playing standards has dropped dramatically since Sir Alex Ferguson retired in 2013.

Klopp was reportedly offered the United job before the appointment of Louis Van Gaal, but Robbie Fowler claims the current Liverpool boss couldn’t get behind the Red Devils’ vision for the club.

He wrote in the Mirror: ‘I did an interview with him a couple of years ago and he told me he turned down a couple of super-rich clubs after (Borussia) Dortmund – one of them was definitely Manchester United, the other probably Real Madrid – because he hated how they were focused solely on ­commercial influences.

Woodward has faced severe criticism for his running of United (Picture: Getty)

‘He said he liked Liverpool because they had a balance between the money needed to reach the top and the ­history and identity of the club and their fans.’

Klopp’s tenure at Liverpool finally paid dividends last season when the Reds won the Champions League and finished second in the Premier League.

Liverpool are hopeful their long-running league title drought will end this season under the guidance of Klopp, with the Reds eight points clear at the top of the table.

United welcome Liverpool to Old Trafford when the international break ends next weekend and Red Devils manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is under pressure to avoid a heavy defeat to the Reds.
